intro: Asperula repens var. glabrata, commonly known as the smooth trailing azalea, is a low-growing evergreen shrub native to the mountainous regions of Japan. It features dense clusters of small, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink and red, blooming in late spring to early summer. The plant has smooth, glossy leaves that are typically oval to elliptical in shape. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soil and partial to full shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and ground covers. Its compact growth habit and ornamental flowers make it a valuable addition to shady garden landscapes.
